trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate GCM with Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate GCM with Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the How to Integrate Engagement on Android document before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: This document is useful only if you integrated either the Reach module for any time campaign support.
trans-unit.target: This document is useful only if you integrated either the Reach module for any time campaign support.

trans-unit.source: To integrate Reach campaigns in your application, please read first How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android.
trans-unit.target: To integrate Reach campaigns in your application, please read first How to Integrate Engagement Reach on Android.

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Integrating GCM allows your application to be pushed even when it's not running.
trans-unit.target: Integrating GCM allows your application to be pushed even when it's not running.

trans-unit.source: No campaign data is actually sent via GCM, it's just a background signal telling the application to fetch the Engagement push.
trans-unit.target: No campaign data is actually sent via GCM, it's just a background signal telling the application to fetch the Engagement push.

trans-unit.source: If the application is not running while receiving a GCM push, it triggers a connection to the Engagement servers to fetch the push, the Engagement connection remains active for about a minute in case the user launches the application in the response to the push.
trans-unit.target: If the application is not running while receiving a GCM push, it triggers a connection to the Engagement servers to fetch the push, the Engagement connection remains active for about a minute in case the user launches the application in the response to the push.

trans-unit.source: For your information, Engagement uses only [Send-to-Sync] messages with the engagement.tickle collapse key.
trans-unit.target: For your information, Engagement uses only [Send-to-Sync] messages with the engagement.tickle collapse key.

trans-unit.source: Only devices running Android 2.2 or above, having Google Play installed and having Google background connection enabled can be woken up by GCM; however, you can integrate this code safely on older versions of the Android SDK and on devices that can't support GCM (it just uses intents).
trans-unit.target: Only devices running Android 2.2 or above, having Google Play installed and having Google background connection enabled can be woken up by GCM; however, you can integrate this code safely on older versions of the Android SDK and on devices that can't support GCM (it just uses intents).

trans-unit.source: If the application cannot be woken up by GCM, the Engagement notification will be received the next time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: If the application cannot be woken up by GCM, the Engagement notification will be received the next time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: If your own client code manages C2DM registration identifiers while the Engagement SDK is configured to use GCM, a conflict on the registration identifiers occurs, use GCM in Engagement only if your own code does not use C2DM.
trans-unit.target: If your own client code manages C2DM registration identifiers while the Engagement SDK is configured to use GCM, a conflict on the registration identifiers occurs, use GCM in Engagement only if your own code does not use C2DM.

trans-unit.source: Sign up to GCM and enable GCM Service
trans-unit.target: Sign up to GCM and enable GCM Service

trans-unit.source: If not already done, you must enable the GCM Service on your Google account.
trans-unit.target: If not already done, you must enable the GCM Service on your Google account.

trans-unit.source: At the time of writing this document (February 5th, 2014), you can follow the procedure at: [<html></html>].
trans-unit.target: At the time of writing this document (February 5th, 2014), you can follow the procedure at: [<html></html>].

trans-unit.source: Follow that procedure just to enable GCM on your account.
trans-unit.target: Follow that procedure just to enable GCM on your account.

trans-unit.source: When you reach the Obtaining an API Key section, don't read it and go back to this page instead of following the Google procedure any further.
trans-unit.target: When you reach the Obtaining an API Key section, don't read it and go back to this page instead of following the Google procedure any further.

trans-unit.source: The procedure explains that the Project Number is used as the GCM sender ID, you need it later in this procedure.
trans-unit.target: The procedure explains that the Project Number is used as the GCM sender ID, you need it later in this procedure.

trans-unit.source: Project Number is not to be confused with Project ID.
trans-unit.target: Project Number is not to be confused with Project ID.

trans-unit.source: Project ID can now be different (it's a name on new projects).
trans-unit.target: Project ID can now be different (it's a name on new projects).

trans-unit.source: What you need to integrate in the Engagement SDK is the Project Number and is displayed in the Overview menu in the [Google Developers Console].
trans-unit.target: What you need to integrate in the Engagement SDK is the Project Number and is displayed in the Overview menu in the [Google Developers Console].

trans-unit.source: SDK integration
trans-unit.target: SDK integration

trans-unit.source: Managing device registrations
trans-unit.target: Managing device registrations

trans-unit.source: Each device must send a registration command to the Google servers, otherwise they can't be reached.
trans-unit.target: Each device must send a registration command to the Google servers, otherwise they can't be reached.

trans-unit.source: A device can also unregister from GCM notifications (the device is automatically unregistered if the application is uninstalled).
trans-unit.target: A device can also unregister from GCM notifications (the device is automatically unregistered if the application is uninstalled).

trans-unit.source: If you use the [GCM client library], you can directly read android-sdk-gcm-receive.
trans-unit.target: If you use the [GCM client library], you can directly read android-sdk-gcm-receive.

trans-unit.source: If you don't already send the registration intent yourself, you can make Engagement register the device automatically for you.
trans-unit.target: If you don't already send the registration intent yourself, you can make Engagement register the device automatically for you.

trans-unit.source: To enable this, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag:
trans-unit.target: To enable this, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag:

trans-unit.source: Communicate registration id to the Engagement Push service and receive notifications
trans-unit.target: Communicate registration id to the Engagement Push service and receive notifications

trans-unit.source: In order to communicate the registration id of the device to the Engagement Push service and receive its notifications, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag (even if you manage device registrations yourself):
trans-unit.target: In order to communicate the registration id of the device to the Engagement Push service and receive its notifications, add the following to your AndroidManifest.xml file, inside the tag (even if you manage device registrations yourself):

trans-unit.source: Ensure you have the following permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml (after the tag).
trans-unit.target: Ensure you have the following permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml (after the tag).

trans-unit.source: Grant Engagement access to a Server API Key
trans-unit.target: Grant Engagement access to a Server API Key

trans-unit.source: If not already done, create a Server API Key on [Google Developers Console].
trans-unit.target: If not already done, create a Server API Key on [Google Developers Console].

trans-unit.source: The Server Key MUST NOT have IP restriction.
trans-unit.target: The Server Key MUST NOT have IP restriction.

trans-unit.source: At the time of writing this document (February 5th, 2014), the procedure is the following:
trans-unit.target: At the time of writing this document (February 5th, 2014), the procedure is the following:

trans-unit.source: To do so, open [Google Developers Console].
trans-unit.target: To do so, open [Google Developers Console].

trans-unit.source: Select the same project as earlier in the procedure (the one with the Project Number you integrated in AndroidManifest.xml).
trans-unit.target: Select the same project as earlier in the procedure (the one with the Project Number you integrated in AndroidManifest.xml).

trans-unit.source: Go to APIs & auth -\> Credentials, click on "CREATE NEW KEY" in the "Public API access" section.
trans-unit.target: Go to APIs & auth -\> Credentials, click on "CREATE NEW KEY" in the "Public API access" section.

trans-unit.source: Select "Server key".
trans-unit.target: Select "Server key".

trans-unit.source: On next screen, leave it blank (no IP restriction), then click on Create.
trans-unit.target: On next screen, leave it blank (no IP restriction), then click on Create.

trans-unit.source: Copy the generated API key.
trans-unit.target: Copy the generated API key.

trans-unit.source: Go to $/\#application/YOUR\_ENGAGEMENT\_APPID/native-push.
trans-unit.target: Go to $/\#application/YOUR\_ENGAGEMENT\_APPID/native-push.

trans-unit.source: In GCM section edit the API Key with the one you just generated and copied.
trans-unit.target: In GCM section edit the API Key with the one you just generated and copied.

trans-unit.source: You are now able to select "Any Time" when creating Reach announcements and polls.
trans-unit.target: You are now able to select "Any Time" when creating Reach announcements and polls.

trans-unit.source: Engagement actually needs a Server Key, an Android Key cannot be used by Engagement servers.
trans-unit.target: Engagement actually needs a Server Key, an Android Key cannot be used by Engagement servers.

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test

trans-unit.source: Now please verify your integration by reading How to Test Engagement Integration on Android.
trans-unit.target: Now please verify your integration by reading How to Test Engagement Integration on Android.
